title: Quant UX 2023 Workshop:An Open Source Framework forChoice Based Conjoint Experiments in R
text:
Quant UX 2023 Workshop:An Open Source Framework forChoice Based Conjoint Experiments in R







John Paul Helveston


June 15, 2023


George Washington University






Part 1: Introduction
In this section, we will address:

What is conjoint analysis?
Why R?
High-level overview of open source conjoint workflow.



Part 2: Designing surveys with {cbcTools}
In this section, we will discuss how to use the {cbcTools} package to design and test choice-based conjoint surveys, including:

Design of experiment
Simulating choices
Assessing power



Part 3: Estimating models with {logitr}
In this section, we will discuss how to use the {logitr} package to estimate logit models on simulated data, including:

Mixed logit models
WTP space models



Part 4: Fielding surveys with formr
In this section, we will discuss how to use the formr platform to field conjoint surveys online, including:

Using RMarkdown to design a survey
Implementing a choice-based conjoint survey in formr
